bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, March 7, 1938

div1.p: Hench thanks Moran for the photographs and will have slides made of them. He offers medical advice for Andrus. He notes that Kissinger is expected to give a talk on his experiences.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, March 7, 1938
div1.opener:
March 7, 1938
Mr. John J. Moran
c/o Compania Sunoco de Cuba S. A.
Avenida de Menocal No. 102-A
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for your letter. It is awfully nice of you to
send me the photographs, and I am sorry you would not accept the little check
for the trouble that you took. I am taking the liberty of having copies made
of the two old photographs, and am returning them, as undoubtedly you wish
them back. I am delighted to keep the other two recent ones. I am returning
the black one with the request that you inscribe it to me at the top of the
photo.

I shall take your advice about getting in touch with the other survivors
and shall be glad to do whatever I can for Mr. Andrus. If, at any time, I can
be of possible help to you, please let me know. It is most certain that if you
did come here, we would not operate on you unless it was obvious that you
needed it or could stand it. So, if you ever happen to get near here and want
to come, do not hesitate to do so because of the fear that we might operate.

I am going to Europe next week for two months. Shortly after my return
in May, we hope to have Mr. Kissinger run up from Indiana and give a talk
before one of our societies, on his experiences. I know he will be interested
to look over the letters that you have sent me, and I am taking the liberty
of having lantern slides made from the pictures you have sent me, which will
be used in connection with some other slides I am having made for Mr. Kissinger.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
